conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict whether it flows into container D or E after passing through baffles.
Liquid starts flowing from three different points: A (yellow), B (cyan), and C (blue and green).
Yellow liquid from A flows downwards and encounters the diagonal gray baffle, which redirects it towards the center.
Cyan liquid from B flows straight down until it hits the horizontal black baffle, then is redirected towards the center.
Blue and green liquids from C flow down and are redirected by the horizontal black baffle towards the center.
All three liquids (yellow, cyan, blue, and green) converge and flow together towards the bottom center of the structure.
The liquids are further guided by the horizontal black baffle and the diagonal purple baffle, both directing the flow towards the center area.
The combined flow is directed towards the center container (E) due to the alignment and influence of the baffles.
Final answer: The liquid will flow into container E.
